title.rendered: Perth vs Melbourne, Australian T20 League 2022: Today’s Match Preview, Fantasy Cricket Tips

content.rendered:
We have opted for a fantasy cricket team based on the recent performances, overall impact, and credit points.

Probable XIs

Perth: Cameron Bancroft, Stephen Eskinazi, Aaron Hardie, Josh Inglis (wk), Ashton Turner (c), Nick Hobson, Ashton Agar, Andrew Tye, David Payne, Peter Hatzoglou, Lance Morris

Kane Richardson will miss the clash due to an injury.

Melbourne: Martin Guptill, Jake Fraser-McGurk, Sam Harper (wk), Aaron Finch (c), Matthew Critchley, Jonathan Wells, Will Sutherland, Tom Rogers, Jack Prestwidge, Corey Rocchiccioli, Fawad Ahmed

Pitch Report

Venue: Perth Stadium, Perth

(Based on the last 3 games)

1st innings average score: 153

2nd innings average score: 181

Wickets per innings: 6

Type: Excellent for batting

Wins

Batting 1st: —

Batting 2nd: 100%

Fantasy Tips of the Day

Ashton Turner (529 runs at 33) and Andrew Tye (31 wickets) are the highest run-scorer and wicket-taker at Perth respectively.

At the venue, Aaron Hardie has featured in the Ultimate Team in 3 of 4 games this season. His top scores read 90* and 57.

In the T20s between these teams, Aaron Finch has collected the most runs. His 405 runs include 3 fifties and have come at a strike rate of 130.

In the absence of Kane Richardson, Tom Rogers will lead the pace attack. He has taken as many as 16 wickets in the last 10 outings.

Ever since his addition to the team, Lance Morris has made it to the Ultimate Team in all the games: he has taken three two-fors and a three-for.

Martin Guptill’s recent selection percentage may not be encouraging, but the power-hitter has provided a 30-run bonus in 3 of the last 5 games.

In the last 3 games at the venue, an average of 9 wickets fell in the first innings compared to 3 in the second innings. Chasing has been an easy affair.
